meanings.definition: To carry out or execute a task or action before it is officially required.
meanings.sent1: The students were preforming their science experiment ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys preforming her chores early in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The chef was preforming a secret recipe for his friends.
meanings.sent4: The athlete preforming a victory dance before the game even started.
meanings.sent5: The birds preforming their morning songs filled the air with music.

meanings.definition: To shape or mold a material into a specific form before further processing.
meanings.sent1: The artist was preforming the clay into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent2: He is preforming the metal into a unique design.
meanings.sent3: The baker was preforming the dough into various shapes for the cookies.
meanings.sent4: The potter preforming the clay on the wheel with skillful hands.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor preforming the marble into a lifelike statue.

meanings.definition: To give a preliminary performance or rehearsal before the actual event.
meanings.sent1: The band was preforming their new song before the concert.
meanings.sent2: She was preforming her lines for the play in front of the director.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was preforming his jokes to a small audience at the club.
meanings.sent4: The dancers were preforming their routine in the empty theater.
meanings.sent5: The actors were preforming their scenes to warm up before the show.
